newsitem.title: USA: StructuralDynamics says gets Rockwell order.
newsitem.headline: StructuralDynamics says gets Rockwell order.

text.p: Structural Dynamics Research Corp said on Tuesday it received an order valued at about $1 million from Rockwell International Corp's Space Systems Division.

The order was for computer-assisted design and manufacturing software, maintenance and services for Rockwell's portion of the next generation of Navstar Global Positioning System satellites for the U.S. Air Force Space and Missile Systems Center, SDRC said in a statement.
SDRC spokesman James Jackson termed the order "very significant" for SDRC.

"It's another significant aerospace win," Jackson said in a telephone interview. SDRC has also designed software for Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp and has established a facility for satellite design and related technology, he said.
In late 1996, Rockwell's aerospace and defense businesses, with annual sales of about $3 billion, will become part of Boeing, pending shareholder approval.
